Our rooms was very comfortable and well appointed and the free breakfast in the mornings was a nice touch. It's an older building with some creaky floors, but that adds to the charm, IMO. Would return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing find in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Bryan-P-C
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel from start of booking process to departure. Elizabeth Carr handles our email booking with efficiency and care. As a party of 4 we were directed to a 2 bedroom suite on the top floor. When we arrived - amazing!!!!! Views over the bay from Pacific Heights were stunning and unexpected. Apparently Presidents have stayed here - I can see why. Suite was individual and spotlessly clean. Bathrooms also. Beds were the most comfortable we had during our stay in California. Linens were were too. A real find away from the corporate chains of hotels. More people should be encouraged to try something a little different like the Drisco - the service you get can sometimes be a real eye opener when you consider the cost of other places. Will always stay here if in SF again. Plus the Chocolate cookies at turn down were a hit!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and exquisite”
Reviews.Author: roughgem
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I drove from San Francisco to San Diego over the course of nine days. We spent three nights in San Fran at the Hotel Drisco. In hindsight, San Fran was easily the best part of the trip and this is my favorite hotel that I have ever stayed at. You can't beat the location and everything about the rooms and the decor is charming and delightful, The views are remarkable from most rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: hanord
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Drisco for a couple of nights in May. Great hotel at a great location for people who like to stroll around in San Francisco like us. We had a fantastic view from the room. It's the kind of place I'd like to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, beware of Parking Situation”
Reviews.Author: Learned_TravelParent
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times and have enjoyed my room on each occasion. Always clean and comfortable and the location of the hotel is very nice.I would say that if you want the room to be more quite take one on an upper floor, the rooms at the bottom are noisy because of the dining room and side street. My main problem with this hotel is that there is no parking. You have to park on the street and you must be very diligent to pay attention to the signs or your car will be towed. I am speaking from experience and it cost me $600 to have it returned. When I went to the front desk to get the number of the city towing lot, they had it readily available and said "Sorry, it happens a lot, they are really strict about parking in this area." If this issue was so common they should be proactive about solving it. My suggestion would be that upon arrival the hotel could provide a small map of the immediate surrounding streets to show where parking can be found and the schedule of street cleaning, resident parking hours, etc. This would be an easy problem to avoid in the future and one that no doubt is costing the hotel repeat customers.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Engagement Trip”
Reviews.Author: Cassius_Boltus
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I went to San Fransisco to celebrate our engagement, and we couldn't have picked a better place to stay! The accomodations were beautiful and classic, just the type of place for a memorable vacation. Bob at the front desk was absolutely wonderful - and very helpful. We took advantage of the free town car service to Union Square and enjoyed talking with the driver. The breakfasts were delicious and filling, and the wine and cheese happy hours were the perfect appetizer. Bottom Line: Great location. Beautiful city. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a lovely neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: JPit1
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on Tripadvisor for Hotel Drisco before travelling and my expectations were high. The hotel exceeded those expectations - it was a great hotel with excellent service. The rooms were large and clean. The complimentary breakfast was great, with a good selection of food and drinks, served in a lovely breakfast room. The concierge was especially helpful, they always offered a welcoming and personalised service. Pacific Heights is a lovely neighbourhood, with some great local restaurants. There are plenty of buses to get you in to central San Francisco. A perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “This is the only place to stay in SF!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonRick
Reviews.Content: What a find, what a truly fantastic hotel! I booked Hotel Drisco after reading reviews here on Trip Advisor, again the reviews matched the experience. The hotel is situated in Pacific Heights in a very residential area but only minutes from Marina District and downtown. I actually rather enjoyed the fact that it was slightly out of the way. We arrived late and were warmly greeted, shown to our room which really had the "wow" factor. The building is beautifully decorated, in keeping with the period of the building. Warm colours and eleganat furnishings made this feel like a "botique" 5 star experience. The room was large with a lovely view over the city, bed was incredibly comfortable and the cleanliness was of the highest standard, possibly the best I've seen! The experience from moment of arrival to departure was absolutely wonderful, this is now my first choice place to stay in San Francisco. If you fancy something different to the more corporate style hotels around Union Square then look at the Drisco, its warm, elegant and in a great location. I'm looking forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Rather dated, too far out of the city”
Reviews.Author: MattCSenior
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop of our holiday and after staying in a 5 star hotel in Vegas, this hotel did not compare and that may be a little harsh. The hotel was beautifully decorated throughout to fit the manner of the architecture and the surroundings of the area but it felt old fashioned and dated. The hotel was located around 3 miles from the city centre, which in San Francisco is a long way if you fancy a walk! Our room was on the 4th floor and the elevator did not fill you with confidence as it clunked and clattered its way slowly upwards. We were also unfortunate to back onto the elevator shaft so were occasionally woken by the noise and the room also had an archaic heating system that spurted out heat whenever it wanted and as loud as it could. The room was satisfactory and cleaned daily. Although the cleaners tended to knock on your door before 9.00am so a lie in was out of the question. Breakfast was on a buffet basis, a wide choice and very substantial. Overall a lovely traditional hotel, that has kept its character but it was too far away from the city's attractions and it wasn't for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel atop the hills of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: claydemler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the hotel's limo service pick us up from the airport. The driver was courteous and drove us safely to the hotel. Upon our arrival, we were greeted at the hotel front door by the bellman and the front desk manager. Both were very welcoming and got us to our room quickly. They explained the hotel's features and a map of the area. The wine tasting receptions (free) in the evenings and the breakfasts (free) were definitely relaxing and a pleasure to enjoy. Probably the best service and most enjoyable stay we've had at any hotel in the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GAZBOW
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel (5 nights) as the last part of a holiday package seeing Las Vegas, Hawaii, and San Francisco. Located in Pacific Heights district, 15 minutes (by bus) from Union Square, Wharf area. The Hotel definitely deserves its rating in Trip advisor (currently no.1in SF area) John and Marti at front desk were oustandingly helpful, identifying quality restaurants within the area and making reservations for us. Each restaurant was first class, even though they were slightly pricey.. MArti also booked a wine tasting trip to the Napa region for us, another oustanding recommendation. Our room , a descent sized one at that, was located on the floor above reception over looking the side street. Very clean and tastefully presented. (Biscuits -cookies- left on the bed in the evening). Exeptional ensuite, large enough wardrode, very comfotable bed, good Large LCD TV. Breakfast (continental) choice of cereal, breads, fruit, juices, tea/coffee, cheese etc, good start to the day. In the evening the hotel presented wine tasting, Julio being the host. His life story is a must. Purchased 3 day MUNI ticket (bus pass covers use on buses, trams, cable cars) from reception, bus stop located at bottom of hill (5 min walk). This is a well worth way of getting around the city. The only downside to hotel location is the HILL from bus stop, it doesn't look like much, until you get half way up - i'm sure you would get used to it if you lived in SF. But don't let that put you off. We will be back to Hotel Drisco, that I'm sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Suburbs, not for the young”
Reviews.Author: VPraj
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the suburbs, not really close to tourist attractions. It is far away from bars, restaurants and public transportation. You need a car for it. Parking isn't easy, but the staff does let you know where you can park so you don't have to move your car every 3 hours. Breakfast is nice, a lot of fresh fruit. Gym is small and smells funny. The room is nice and large, and they give you nice cookies everynight. Staff is helpful and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: mygirls8689
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the comfort of a luxury hotel with the feel of a bed & breakfast. It was extremely clean and the staff could not have been more helpful. This was my first experience at this hotel & if I ever go back to San Francisco, I will be sure to stay here. It's located far enough away from all the noise & congestion of downtown San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: parisigirl
Reviews.Content: On April 23rd my husband and I got married in St. Helena. After spending 5 nights in Napa Valley, we left for San Francisco on Tuesday, April 26th for our last night. I read all the great reviews for Hotel Drisco and was excited to check in. From the moment we pulled up to leaving first thing the next morning, our stay was absolutely fabulous. Everyone took care of us, especially Marti, the concierge. When she found out a few days prior that we just got married she upgraded us to the city view suite. When we got inside they had a split of champagne on ice, a beautiful wedding card and a small gift. At turn down service they put rose pedals on our bed in the shape of a heart. They have a great happy hour with a nice selection of wines, cheeses, crackers and the like. Julio took care of us and what fun I had with him learning how to fold fancy napkins! Since we got there around lunch time we asked Marti where she recommended we have lunch. She quickly recommended the Woodhouse Fish Company on Fillmore Street. We were not disappointed! It was one of the best meals all week. For dinner she recommended another gem, Girabaldi's. Marti had advised them we were coming and had just gotten married and they greeted us with 2 glasses of prosecco. We so enjoyed talking to Marti. Her professionalism combined with her wonderful personality made our last night in San Francisco very special. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Exception customer service”
Reviews.Author: MomSwan
Reviews.Content: I am finally getting around to leaving a review for our December or 2010 trip. Hotel Drisco was our first stop on a vacation during which we stayed at 4 different hotels, all highly rated. The hotel is beautiful & the staff, gracious and welcoming. Julie the concierge called our home prior to our trip to help us make dining arrangements and offer any other advice we might need. We had a group of family who live near San Francisco who came into town to greet us. It was lovely to have the common areas of the hotel to visit with them, the staff was so good to us. There was plenty of parking avalible close by on the street. The wine & cheese reception, the cookies, fruit and bottled water in the rooms, & the extensive and delicious breakfast offerings, made us feel disappointed by the hotels that followed. I would not hesitate at all to choose Hotel Drisco, we felt so at home there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, perfect for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: fullygr0wnlady
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as part of our honeymoon tour of the west coast in April. This was the best hotel we stayed in - we absolutely loved it! It is very different to the modern hotels we stayed in on other parts of the trip - this one one is grand and old style, with afternoon drinks and an actual key for your room. The staff were lovely and very helpful. The location is stunning - Pacific Heights is the most beautiful area and you are surrounded by traditional houses and views of the bay. SF is very hilly so do expect a few walks up and down steep roads - but it is totally worth it. Follow Pacific Avenue right down and you are in china town which is great fun. The room was lovely and big and had a luxurious bathroom - you really felt you were staying in a big old housein the 1940s. The hotel has a lounge where you can get tea and coffee 24/7 and home made biscotti in the afternoons. The breakfast was included and was a nice buffet with plenty of options. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city - but especially if you are looking for some quirky charm and tradition. This was just the perfect place for a honeymoon escape.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming SF Option”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Drisco to be a charming option for San Francisco. It is in Pacific Heights, which is a bit removed from downtown. The hotel offers morning car service downtown, which made it easy for me to go to my meetings downtown. The service at the Drisco is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: fitzpemberley
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked into the Hotel Drisco (after driving up and down those crazy rollercoaster streets), I knew I was in heaven. The hotel is decorated in exactly my style, which may bias me toward the hotel. But the room was cozy, the breakfasts were good, and it was in a beautiful neighborhood. We liked walking around looking at all the mansions. The only negative I would give is that it's not really close to many major attractions in San Francisco, but if you have a car, you'll be fine. Parking was never really a big deal for us either.

Reviews.Title: “"Boutique Fabulous-ness!"...truly diva worthy!”
Reviews.Author: JessikaSterling
Reviews.Content: I'm a hotel designer and travel the world doing hotels of all types...so I know what I'm talking about. This little gem in SF was truly fabulous! The amazing thing about the Drisco is how they treated me under my unique circumstances...I am transgender and was there recovering from some cosmetic surgery. The staff was truly amazing...and went above and beyond to make my 2 week stay there perfect! Extra pillows, special meals, arranging transportation...and the ability to put up with me in full diva-mode deserves a medal. ...plus, having the bellman teach my aunt tai chi in our suite was truly entertaining...lol Given, this hotel has all the 4-star amenities...except room service and central heat, but the service more than made up for the couple chilly nights and temporary power outage...since we were there in February during a freak winter storm, it was not a major flaw. I'm coming back this summer, and it's so nice to know I already have my hotel accommodations set and I know the staff will remember me. ...how could they forget ...I'm fabulous also!!!...haha xoxo Jessika Las Vegas [-] ps I almost don't want to write this review since I want to keep this place a secret. I hope the Drisco doesn't get too popular and lose it's charm...xoxo

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as expected”
Reviews.Author: HLLF
Reviews.Content: Booked after reading trip advisor and was totally happy with experience - initially was concerned at location but quickly came to appreciate it. Had a fabulous suite that looked to Alcatraz and price at $350 odd very much ok by comparison to others. John at desk very welcoming and helpful. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect start”
Reviews.Author: Pengowls1
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here at the beginning of a longer trip and it provided the ideal beginning: the staff made us extremely welcome; the suite was very comfortable indeed; breakfasts were excellent quality and well presented; all facilities were first-rate...and we enjoyed the 'limo. lift' on our first morning! A great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “An elegant boutique hotel in a great Pacific Heights location.”
Reviews.Author: SusieQTraveler
Reviews.Content: An elegant boutique hotel in a great Pacific Heights location. The room was lovely, with nice neighborhood views. Complimentary offerings (wine/cheese, tea/coffee & WiFi) allowed me to feel pampered . The breakfast was very nice; it included a variety of high-quality offerings. The hotel is a short walk to SF bay views, sites, restaurants and shopping. Pressed for a downside, the only hitch was street parking (though there was availability), and some street noise if the windows were open. But in such a swanky neighborhood, a little walk to the car or the lingering conversations in the air just folded into the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff, but hotel different than I had envisioned”
Reviews.Author: jonah96
Reviews.Content: Just completed our five-day stay at the Hotel Drisco. Note that Iâ€™ve rated it five stars, but that does not mean it was perfect in every way. Frankly, the full 5-star rating is for the service provided and not the hotel per se. Without a doubt, the service my wife and I received was superb down to the very last person, and I mean everyone â€“ door man, housekeeping, maintenance, kitchen staff, front desk, you name it â€“ insanely friendly, helpful, and courteous (and a special thank you to Victor â€“ thank you so much). That said, the hotel itself was not what I expected. I say that not because it isnâ€™t a nice hotel, but because the photos you see online donâ€™t tell the complete picture. Iâ€™m also not suggesting they are misleading, but in total, I don't think they provide a full visual description of the environment. Below are a few examples, with the understanding I mean these to be observations (not criticisms) so you have a fuller understanding of what to expect than I did. 1. The hotel is in a beautiful upscale residential neighborhood. Youâ€™re surrounded by houses (many of which are mansions) and no commerce. This can be good or bad, depending on how you see it. In one sense, you feel like a resident of the city (good, IMO); on the other, you have no access to basic amenities (snacks, pharmaceuticals, etc) outside what the hotel provides (not so good). 2. You are literally at the peak of a hill, which, depending on your room, can provide you a spectacular view of either the city or Alcatraz/Golden Gate Bridge. The potential downside, of course, is that you walk up/down very steep hills in all four directions. If youâ€™re using public transportation, be prepared for very steep climbs on return trips because the bus system is one block over and one block down from the hotel. One block over and down doesnâ€™t seem like a big deal until youâ€™ve trekked up and down it several times in a day over a period of days. Bottom line, the hotel is probably not ideal for folks who arenâ€™t comfortable climbing very steep hills regularly but would like to use public transportation as their primary means of transportation during their stay. 3. The hotel is old. Beautiful old building and well maintained (functional, clean), but all the wood floors creak, many areas of the hotel have very uneven flooring, the hallway carpeting is worn down, the room windows are old and difficult to open/close, etc. Again, not a criticism, just an observation. I make this observation because the photos I saw of the rooms gave me the impression HD is a very modern hotel. Simply not the case. It seems more like a remodeled house that tried to retain its original flair. Probably better to think of it like a very large, charming New England B&B than a modern hotel. Depending on your travel habits and hotel preferences, this style may or may not suit you. If youâ€™re more accustomed to (and prefer) business hotels, I would suggest the Hotel Nikko downtown. Although it borders what looks to be a marginal area of town, itâ€™s 100% safe and in a really convenient location for getting around. On the other hand, if you like hotels with character and old-world charm, then I think youâ€™ll love many aspects of the Hotel Drisco. 4. As for the room itself, great mattress and bedding. A hotel for me above all else is for getting a good nightâ€™s sleep, and no issues there. Couple of annoyances, though â€“ the Internet connection worked only intermittently and the front desk seemed unable to sort it out. I donâ€™t spend a great deal of time on the Internet when traveling, but if youâ€™ve got to send an email, find a good restaurant on Yelp, or get bus routes from the hotel to a point in the city (511.org), it gets annoying quickly when you canâ€™t get Internet access as advertised. Another small but relatively annoying thing â€“ youâ€™re issued a room key and minibar key on a keychain. Again, maybe itâ€™s old-world charm, but I find it annoying. I donâ€™t always carry a backpack or other bag, especially when Iâ€™m out exploring, so it annoyed me I had to carry keys in my front pocket. Would much rather have had a room card that fits in my wallet. Again, though, thatâ€™s just my preference. 5. Other points â€“ limited but good breakfast in the morning: oatmeal, hard-boiled eggs, fruit, bagels, pastries, croissants, juices, cereals. Pretty standard fare, but good way to start the day. Apples in the lobby, water upon request, and a wine tasting each evening add to the charm and appeal. In sum, the service at Hotel Drisco was superb, but the physical experience was different than I had originally imagined it would be. Neither bad nor good, just different than my expectations. Be aware of what to expect and you should have a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A historical beauty with out the barking dogs”
Reviews.Author: seemorecoast
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Fairmount for many years and had a bad experience with barking dogs at night, it was decided to make a change. Hotel Drisco is clean, elegant, beautifully restored and in a prime location in the middle of a quiet up scale neighborhood. The room was fully appointed and in tip top condition. The manager of the Hotel personally visited each guest at the breakfast to obtain feedback on the stay. A sincere and most appreciated touch. I would stay again on a romantic get away. The Americaâ€™s Cup 2011,is coming to San Francisco so this will be a great location to share with other friends wanting to enjoy the city from a Hotel that is like a home. Worth the money, a true Five Star Hotel with out the barking dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Scarletrose44
Reviews.Content: Very good attempt at high level service.. Old building (heating and floor boards make a little noise & not much sound proofing) but well kept and maintained.. Beautiful area, close to everything and extremely safe. Little extra's (free wifi-internet, various refreshments i.e. access to daily tea/coffee and afternoon wine reception) give this place that extra touch of class. Hint: Hire a car! It's very easy to navigate San Francisco and there is plenty of parking. Definitely one of the best decisions we made. As mentioned by other reviewers there is on street parking which is free during the weekend, and during the week the hotel staff will move the car for you every 3 hours and to avoid the street cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Serendipitous delight”
Reviews.Author: arrowflight
Reviews.Content: What a treat! we were lucky, and assigned the 'lobby floor' room which fronted onto the 'living room'. It was spacious, quiet, and we could get coffee and treats by just opening our door! The staff were most accomodating; their recommendations were spot on; and the breakfast and evening 'wine' gatherings were simply above and beyond anything that I've experienced in many many years of travel. This hotel is worth a trip to SF for a stay here alone!

Reviews.Title: “the positive reviews are all true”
Reviews.Author: RosiePalms
Reviews.Content: every positive review is pretty much all true. free street parking (friday - sunday, anyway, in a road work zone that shut down for the weekend) excellent staff- (genuinely kind and friendly; than carried our luggage, and our housekeeper was apologetic when our room was not tidied by the time we got back at 1 to refresh for our evening activity; it was ok, we actually sat in the sitting room with laptop and a book (and lemon ice water) and it was fine. (you can request that they get to your room asap, but we were in too good a mood and enjoying our weekend that we really didn't fuss) good complimentary continental b/fast (oatmeal, b/fast rolls, cheese, ham, salmon, fresh fruit, yogurt). no public transportation real close by, but my husband and i walked from the hotel to the house of prime rib on van ness, and it was fine (in our 40 - 50's, not in great shape). this is not a modern, hip hotel, and that's why we loved it; old style fire sprinklers, windows that open up - the decor screams 'old style swank and glamour, and we *loved* it! don't bring your kids and teens here; don't come here if you want to "party" - stay at the wharf for that. oh, and i loved that when you walk into the room, there was classical music playing on the t.v., and there were 2 complimentary water bottles, and a fruit plate with a banana, a tangelo, a red-skin pear and a kiwi - sweet! and they set a hot wet rolled towel on a plate for you to refresh yourself after a day's drive. i stayed in the castle in in nob/russian hill w/my kids last year, but the drisco is the place to go if you want a relaxing day w/ your significant other.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL DRISCO and its STAFF are JEWELS of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: LADYPONSONBY
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end, our stay at Hotel Drisco in Pacific Heights was over the top. The neighborhood is quiet and the architecture is gorgeous to behold. The hotel staff are courteous, welcoming, friendly, warm and knowledgeable. They could not do or recommend enough to make our stay the best it could possibly be. The rooms are beautifully decorated, comfortable and quiet. Tea time at 4:30 is delightful. Take a few minutes for yourself and enjoy a hot cup of tea and some cookies while you relax after a busy day of sightseeing in this fabulous city. The hotel's wine tasting at 5:30 is a great way to start one's evening and meet fellow guests.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, great staff -- careful of parking”
Reviews.Author: GGTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a residential area. The rooms are large and the staff is terrific. It's not a normal full-service hotel -- there is not a valet, a restaurant or room service, although the hotel offers a big continental breakfast and sandwhiches at other times of day. Parking is only available on the street, so be prepared to move your car regularly on weekdays.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: FranckS67
Reviews.Content: This upmarket hotel is located in Pacific Heights, a gentrified suburb of San Francisco. Quiet and safe streets, filled with huge old mansions make, make the location great. We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. The room (306B) had great views over the city and we could see the sunrise over San Francisco from our bed. The decor was classically elegant. There is no air-conditioning in the room, but, being high up, we could open the windows during the day to get the air in. The outside temperature was warm (25ÂºC/77ÂºF), but we never had any problem with the heat. (You probably would have to close them at night if you are a light sleeper and don't want to be woken up by the occasional noise). We had read the reviews about the hotel being too far from downtown, but this wasn't a problem for us because we had a car (plenty of street parking). At night we were going out to dinner in nearby Filmore St (full of nice little restaurants) - a 15min walk through this very nice area. Breakfast is held in a room downstair which feels like you are in your own dining room. Same feeling for the living room were you have drinks, biscuits and newspaper available all day. You can sit in the available sofas and chairs and really feel like you're home. On the downside: one night we thought we'd attend the daily cheese/wine offered by the hotel. But on that day there was noone else in the room and no drinks/cheese were served (we assumed that one probably had to ask for them,and we didn't dare).

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Charles02840
Reviews.Content: The Drisco is a great low-key old hotel in the very upscale residential neighborhood of Pacific Heights. A very attentive and helpful staff plus a more than adequate continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, exceptional neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: kbrjbr
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, we stayed twice in the last year. My suggestion is to avoid rooms near the elevator or on the main floor. If you want to save some money, consider the King with the bathroom across the hall- it's still very private! Great breakfast, nice wine reception. Really great neighborhood to walk in and if you want to be close to the Golden Gate bridge, shopping on Fillmore and Sacramento, the park and the running/biking in the Precidio. Had a nice dinner nearby at Garibaldi's. Not as convenient a location if you want to be close to downtown and Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Will never forget the most special place to celebrate my husbands 40th”
Reviews.Author: rs68conv
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review on trip advisor, although I typically read the reviews. I could not go without thanking the staff at Hotel Drisco for making my husbands birthday the best experience at a hotel. Marti, Bob, and Julio were all so wonderful, we were made to feel so special. Upon arriving, there was no problem parking. Bob helped us with our bags. Marti checked us in and gave us hot towels. They offered to upgrade us to a suite which was a good deal. The room was spectacular. There were views from 2 sides of the building with a sitting room, where you can view the bridge, Alcatraz, and the city skyline. Everything is pristine and white. I purchased the birthday package for my husbands birthday which was a cake and champagne, which they placed in the room while we were out for dinner. They also included a basket with rose petals and bath salts. Its so comfortable and quiet, you feel as if you are staying at someone's very well appointed house. The sunrise was beautiful. There was a free wine reception, which they also had cheese, crackers and grapes. Breakfast was wonderful. Organic selection of coffees, fresh squeezed orange juice, fruit salad, honey, granola, yogurt, selections of cheeses, meat, bagels and fruit. This was one of the best days of my life and this hotel was a big reason for that. I cannot say enough about how wonderful this place is, and I highly recommend it. I will never stay anywhere else but here when I come to San Francisco. Thank you Hotel Drisco!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Boutique Hotel in Pacific Heights”
Reviews.Author: MMcTx
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Drisco is in a beautiful neighborhood location in Pacific Heights. We loved the intimate European styling of this warmly decorated boutique hotel. Wine & cheese happy hour was a nice touch and the home style sitting rooms were very relaxing. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent establishment that spends efforts to stay the best”
Reviews.Author: PiperDownSF
Reviews.Content: Always enjoy my stays at the Drisco. Was pleasantly surprised to see improvements on top of an already established class act. Additions and upgrades to both breakfast and wine/cheese hour spreads. It was a full compliment with nothing left out. Some of the morning upgrades include top of the line teas, fresh deli offerings, etc. For the evening offering; higher end wines, addition of an heated dish like Swedish meatballs. What I considered a five star establishment in the past has now become five star plus. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “We will never stay anywhere else in San Francisco...”
Reviews.Author: mantecaca
Reviews.Content: Our daughter has lived in the city for 8 years. We visit often and have stayed at more SF hotels than I can count. This was our 2nd time at The Hotel Drisco, and it is by far the most pleasant lodging we have run across. It's a charming place that is VERY clean and well taken care of. A great continental breakfast is available, parking on the street (this is a residential area and you must move your car occasionally to avoid a ticket) comfortable beds and a friendly and attentive staff in a quiet setting. They offer all of the little things that make your visit a special one...coffee, tea and lemon water are always available in the parlor and fresh fruit, chocolate cookies and complimentary water left in the room. Other amenities offered that we didn't take advantage of - check out the website for more info. Very reasonable rates for such a quality place. WE LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “I was sad to have to leave!”
Reviews.Author: AliRuby
Reviews.Content: Hotel Drisco was a wonderful place to stay. I would stay there again in an instant and was truly sad to have to leave. The staff was very courteous and the hotel is beautiful. The rooms were very nice and clean, and were also very charming. The breakfast was delicious and they left cookies in my room every night - very sweet! I absolutely loved this hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: wendy1624
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the opportunity to stay at this lovely hotel for my birthday in January. From the time we entered the hotel we were met with the warmest of greetings by the doorman and the reception desk. Parking which is on street only was absolutly not a problem. We were able to walk to really nice restaurants and theaters. We loved the location and had a room with a glorious view. The staff at this hotel goes above and beyond to ensure a fabulous visit. Don't miss the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great place...just not for us.”
Reviews.Author: Katiesarahread
Reviews.Content: I should start with a bit of background. My boyfriend and I were staying with family in Pacifica on holiday from the uk and only had a couple of nights in the city. We had stayed at Parc 55 the first night and Hotel Drisco was our second and final night in the city. The hotel itself is in Pacific Heights which is a considearable distance from any cable car stops, the civic centre, the wharf or union square; basically it was quite out of the way. The hotel is beautifully appointed though and the staff were great. The lady on reception told us about the Lyon street stairway which we ended up walking down and actually all the way to pier 39 from there and it was a great walk. In the evening we wanted to go for some dinner, there were a few places in walking distance but we decided to venture to union street as the giants were playing in the world series. It was another big walk to get to all of the bars and another taxi back to the hotel. Our room was pleasant but they had situated us on the ground floor right next to the dining room which we didn't like but as we were only there for 1 night I didn't say anything. The room was lovely and clean and at one point a lady came round offering us cookies and ice! Nice touch! There was also a wine reception in the evening which was again pleasant, but not for my partner and I. We felt the hotel was catering for an older audience than me (23) and my boyfriend (25). Stay here if you have a car and you're not too fussed on being close to where everything is going on. This would also be a nice place to stay if you are travelling on your own as there is opportunities to meet and chat to people but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Dilene
Reviews.Content: Bar None, the best place we have ever stayed in San Francisco in the last 10 trips. We had a fabulous corner suite. This is the second time we have stayed at the hotel. There was never an issue wih service or cleanliness. The location is in a quiet area, yet it is close to the ocean. You can see the ocean from the hotel. Fabulous breakfasts and cocktail hours!. I asked my husband where he would like to stay next time we come to San Francisco - and he said- I am coming right back to the Drisco!!

Reviews.Title: “Liking going home... if you lived in a gorgeous home in Pacific Heights!”
Reviews.Author: OneTrueMan
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Francisco at least ten times per year for business. I've stayed at most of the great SF hotels (and many of the not-so-great ones!). But I keep coming back to The Drisco. It is charming without being precious, elegant without being pretentious, quiet without being moribund, solicitous without being unctuous... in short, an old-world style hotel which has somehow managed to keep up with an overall modern world (although a few more sockets for charging the inevitable electronic device mess would be great). No, they don't have all the amenities that a typical modern hotel might have. And no, there is not a hot-spot bar on the ground floor. And the floors creak a bit. And the elevator is small. And the temperature in the room is occasionally a bit difficult to control. But the wood is lovingly polished. The front stairs are swept hourly by the incredibly polite doorman, Than. The front desk staff is mind-bendingly pleasant. The breakfast is delicious and simple, served in a room that one could imagine would be frequented by the British aristocracy, looking for a quiet place to nosh. In short, the overall experience is so damn satisfying that the hotel's few quirks (and don't get me wrong - there are some!) , far from being inconveniences, are actually additive to the experience. If you are looking for a modern business hotel, don't bother. But if you are looking for a place you can return to again and again, and never tire of the welcome you will receive, The Drisco is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “There is no place like home at the Drisco.......”
Reviews.Author: marciajw
Reviews.Content: The Drisco always draws us back; warm and full of light and perfect in scale and comfort! I feel like I am walking into the foyer of my own home. Fresh basket of apples and mints in the front hall, always fresh coffee & tea & orange water in the 'living room', amazing happy hour w/wine,cheese, olives, & nuts. Friendly, intelligent, conversational service. Need silver polish for a necklace? Find the kitchen, find the polish! Towels are fluffy, bath products good quality, windows OPEN, rooms comfortable and quiet. Not an early morning person? Wear your sweats down to breakfast or have it delivered to your room. What is your breakfast preference? Hotel Drisco serves it. I LOVE this hotel. I could live there. Like Eloise at the Plaza.....

Reviews.Title: “A must stay for all visitors”
Reviews.Author: Tuckerton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for first trip to the City. Location is quiet, but easy to access all of the City, not just the tourist areas. Hotel is extremely comfortable and feels like a home. Stayed in Pacific suite which had all the amenties and lots of space. The key to this hotel is the staff, they are excellent. They have fantastic local knowledge which they share in a very friendly manner. This ranges from places to visit, where to eat (where the locals go) and always a friendly smile and hello. This hotel made our trip as much as the walk across the Golden Gate Bridge. We saw all of the City, but would return just to enjoy this hotel and the people who work here.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay anywhere else when I visit San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: Patricia022
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many San Francisco Hotels but never again! The Hotel Drisco is my new home in the city. The neighborhood is lovely and quiet, the staff is courteous and helpful, the rooms are comfortable and immaculate, the complimentary breakfast delicious. Real fresh orange juice! Although this hotel isn't downtown there are many restaurants and shops within walking distance. And isn't walking part of the San Francisco experience after all!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: mandm070359
Reviews.Content: While in san Francisco we stayed at this boutique hotel for 2 nights at the beginning of our trip and one night at the end of our trip as we visit Sonoma and Napa in between. This is a great find that was recommended by other Trip Advisor guests. It is in a residential neighbourhood so you will have to drive or cab to most restaurants. We enjoyed this fact as we were able to appreciate the hustle and bustle of the city and then go back to our quiet hotel. Ours rooms (201 and 209) faced the interior so we did not have a view but the rooms are beautifully appointed with nice bathrooms. The breakfast that is included was really good with a lot of selection. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. If we were to stay again I would request a room with a better view, but besides that, the price was much better than downtown locations. The front desk referred us to a bicycle rental location that was substantially cheaper than renting bikes on the Pier. Taking your bikes over Golden Gat bridge and then lunch is Sausalito was one of highlights of our trip. You will not be disappointed in this hotel if you are OK staying outside of city center.

Reviews.Title: “Joyful!”
Reviews.Author: AudreyKissane
Reviews.Content: Service and location far exceeded our expectations! Stay there. You definitely feel like you are staying at a good friend's luxury home.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond Staff”
Reviews.Author: PrincessRobbo
Reviews.Content: I won't go over old gound by describing rooms, breakfast etc. Take it as read that all was of the highest quality. I did notice that the rooms near reception and the dining room looked a little gloomy and would be subject to some noise. However, I can only comment on my own experience. Our room 209 only faced an inner section and therefore was a little on the dark side and as the weather was very warm the room did get warm even with the window open. That apart the hotel exceeded my expections. I chose the area as we wanted to be out of the centre and it was on probably one of the most beautiful streets in the whole of San Francisco. It wasn't difficult to get around. The hotel's most valuable commodity were the staff. Without exception they were brilliant. From the doormen to reception they were the most helpful and knowledgeable of any hotel that I think I've ever stayed in. The housekeeping was very impressive and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. If we were to return to San Francisco I would stay here again but would opt for a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: tracker2010
Reviews.Content: An elegant hotel in a beautiful and quiet residential area away from the noise of the city yet easy to comute.The room was spacious and tastefully decorated with a very comfortable bed and a luxury en-suite. The complimentary continental breakfast was served in the light and spacious dining room where evening cheese and wine was also served which gave a special touch before going out for dinner. All the staff were friendly and helpful giving you restaurant tips and maps and directions to the best sites. Pacific Heights is at the top of a steep hill situated among lovely houses and parks but a walk down some steep steps towards the marina will reward you with great views of the Bay and Golden Gate Bidge. This was the last 5 nights of a 3 and a half week trip driving from LA to SF and what an excellent hotel to end our holiday in California. A hotel that we would recommend to our friends and would certainly use again.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel we've every stayed at”
Reviews.Author: LondonPookie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Drisco for part of our honeymoon, and loved every minute. We spent a bit more money on an upgrade and were treated to lovely views of San Francisco. The room was lovely, the service was great, and the atmosphere was relaxed. Highlights for us, were, as mentioned, the lovely room. The breakfast was lovely, and a nice touch that there was coffee and tea available all day in the lounge. It is a $10 taxi ride into the downtown area, but we didn't find this an issue. We loved staying in the Pacific Heights area, and there were two lovely streets (Chesnut and Lombard) which had a great selection of restaurants, bars and shops. So, in the evening we stayed in our area on most days rather than going back into the downtown area. There's also a shuttle taxi service available in the morning. On one occasion, the front desk staff forgot to call them and we would've missed our Alcatraz trip. In the UK, where we live, the hotel staff would've just shrugged their shoulders at such a mistake. in Drisco, they said sorry and quickly ordered a taxi at their own expense. I'd love to go back, and would highly recommend that people try this hotel to make their stay in the city a special one.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here”
Reviews.Author: WallisKH
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel with lovely homely touches and such friendly helpful staff. It is very well priced too.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: klkb
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our teenage son and daughter. We arrived late at night. The rooms had only one bed so my daughter and I shared one and my husband and son reluctantly shared another. We planned to move the next day. However, the rooms were so luxurious we stayed 2 nights as planned. The rooms were a bit small, but very comfortable. The bathrooms were wonderful. We planned on eating at Sears, our traditional breakfast place in San Francisco. The breakfast buffet does not have a large selection as we are accustomed. Many of the guests are European. In fact, the breakfast buffet is a very European breakfast.However, the items there were so delicious we stayed and ate there both days. Lattes and cappuccino's are free. The dining area is beautiful, modeled like an elegant living room. Caution, not all of the rooms have attached bathrooms. If you make reservations in advance make sure you get attached bathrooms. If you don't get one, each room comes with a bathrobe and slippers. The unattached bathrooms are private, assigned to each room.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lizburden
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a residential area away from the noise of the city yet near enough for an easy commute. The staff are very polite and friendly and are always there to offer advice nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are very clean with lovely decor and spacious bathrooms. The selection at breakfast was very good, and the evening cheese and wine added a really special touch before going out to dine. All in all an excellent hotel and we would certainly recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Best in San Fran!”
Reviews.Author: C8282
Reviews.Content: Part of a 2 week California tour we spent 3 nights at the Drisco and then 1 night at Union Square hotel at the end of our trip and we much preferred the Drisco on every level. Whilst you might not be near the main shopping area at the Drisco there is more than enough locally to entertain and it's in a beautiful neighbourhood in SF, where you will feel less like a tourist. There are better restaurants, shops and bars on Fillmore st and Union st (which are close by) and it's within walking distance of the water for amazing views of the Bay and the Golden Gate. The hotel itself is elegant and understated. Breakfast included and a wine reception in the afternoon is also a nice touch. Finally the staff are excellent. All very helpful and friendly. A special mention must go to "Bob" who will plan you a walk, dinner, brunch, anything you want. Only one negative is that we had a room in the basement which was a lovely room but no view, but you can get that anywhere. I won't stay anywhere else if I go back to San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: lancing1
Reviews.Content: We are an english couple who stayed here from 6th September for thee nights. This was the first of six stops around California and Nevada and it was the best. We stayed in a variety of hotels including a large one in las Vegas and taking into account style comfort and service hotel Drisco came out top. We have stayed in San Francisco several times and wanted an area away from the tourists. This was an area that was quiet and elegant with beautiful houses and parks around. We always check out all we can about the hotel and area so we know what to expect. Our room was on the top floof and had views over the city. The room was large, quiet and comfortable. My husband was very surprised at the quality of the frr wine and the breakfast was excellent. The staff were always helpful and we will certainly recommend the hotel to others. we

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect! We loved Hotel Drisco!”
Reviews.Author: MissHollyDay
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Hotel Drisco. We had a two bedroom/two bath suite and it was perfect because we were traveling with our 2 teenagers to visits colleges. The suite was on the corner and had beautiful views because it overlooked the city and the bay. The rooms were very clean and large. The staff was super nice and our bellman Than was extremely helpful. It was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: CathyHV
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was with the same company (Joie de Vivre) as the Dream Inn in Santa Cruz and because the price was good. The hotel is located in Pacific Heights. It's a great neighborhood - picturesque and with all conveniences close by. They upgraded us to a suite and it was fabulous. Bob at the front desk was super helpful and recommended a very good and quick Chinese delivery place - Ho's - since we wanted to have dinner in our comfy room. All the staff members were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included in the room price. There is no hotel parking but there is always free street parking available. During the day, vehicles must be moved every three hours but the hotel staff will do that for you. From 6:00 pm to 11:00 am there is no limit on parking time. Wifi worked fine here.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely elegant town house hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: BristolGardens
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the summer of 2009. It made the perfect start to our wonderful California vacation. The location is excellent, in a beautiful residential street in one of San Francisco's most picturesque areas. At the top of Pacific Heights, but very well served by buses to all areas, and close to great cafes on Fillmore Street and Union Street (Rose's cafe). The room was very elegant, and the hotel feels like a private townhouse. Wonderful European style breakfast. We enjoyed the complimentary wine and cheese served in the same elegant dining room at the end of each afternoon. Hotel Drisco could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: CheshireGrin
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I have ever stayed in! Personal service with attention to detail in all the right areas. VERY CLEAN! We felt safe and comfortable here and the staff treated us like family. Amazing neighbourhood, quite at night, great shopping close-by. A little further from the CBD than most but that added to the appeal and made us feel more like residents than tourists. I could not recommend this hotel enough! The hotel Drisco does not feel like a large chain hotel, it feels like a homely yet professional. I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - much recommended”
Reviews.Author: Dan1295
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from a 5 night stay as part of our honeymoon, and had a really great time. During the honeymoon we had also stayed at a couple of large hotels in Hawaii, and Drisco was much more homely and had a soul. All of the staff without exception were really friendly and always more than happy to help with recommendations etc - especially a guy called Bob. The only potential downside, depending on your view, is the location. The hotel is in Pacific Heights, which is a taxi drive away from Union Square - approx 10 dollars. Personally, though, we didn't see this as a problem - Pacific Heights itself is a really nice, leafy suburb and it's nice to be able to escape the hubbub of the city centre. Possibly because it's a little out of the way, the hotel goes the extra mile with lots of nice touches such as free breakfasts which are really good, free cheese and wine every evening, free taxi service (in the morning) into the city centre etc. All in all, the hotel had a really nice vibe and we were definitely glad we stayed there

Reviews.Title: “Historic San Francisco Hotel & Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: LindeeClaire
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Drisco is a 1903 gem set in the ultra chic Pacific Heights neighborhood. This gorgeous, quiet area is perfect for someone looking a different San Francisco experience than what is offered by the hustle and bustle of Union Square or Fisherman's Wharf areas. The Drisco offers well-priced, nicely appointed large rooms and suites overlooking some of San Francisco's priciest real estate. Included in the rate is free street parking (they will also move your car for you if you head out on foot so you won't get a ticket) and a free breakfast buffet and afternoon wine and appetizers. A walk in any direction is a feast for the eyes with views of the bay and gorgeous homes. Nearby is FIlmore Street with its boutiques and cafes. The Presideo is also within walking distance if you are looking for a more vigorous outing. The Drisco provides handy maps and itineraries depending on your interests that are very helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Drisco - at the Peak of Perfection”
Reviews.Author: LyeCon
Reviews.Content: Checking into the Drisco, the signs were so positive - architectually aesthetic and sitting atop the highest elevation with grand views looking down the streets and across the bay. I had booked a standard double room, beautifully furnished, but unfortunately positioned opposite the dining room. We slept well under top quality bedding until 6.30 am, but from then onwards, it got quite noisy, with staff and guests passing by. Not a huge problem, but on passing this information to the front desk, they were most sympathetic, and for a small charge we were upgraded to a city view suite on the top floor for the remainder of our stay. To say it took our breath away is a gross understatement, it was absolute heaven. Spacious and luxurious, we felt like royalty, as we watched the sun set over the city, drinking chilled Napa Chardonnay. Breakfasts were plentiful and wholesome, made more enjoyable sitting in the sun which the Dining Room captures so well. The reception staff are oh so helpful, with Tom providing a wealth of knowledge and advice on seeing the city, including travel options. Never pretentious, this is a brilliant hotel, with easy access to central areas via a regular and efficient bus service. Echoing other guest reviews, the hotel deserves the positive accolades, but try and avoid the room opposite the Dining Room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: LaliBird
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend staying the Hotel Drisco. Great location. Staff was very welcoming and helpful. We ate at 2 recommened restaurants in area and loved them. Osteria on Sacramento and Out the Door on Bush. Breakast and Wine/Cheese were great and Julio was so friendly and accomodating. Room was small with no view. I had requested a rrom with view also, but may have checked in too late to get one. There is no AC so if it is hot , you need to request fan.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: metfan630
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for our first three nights in San Francisco, and we couldn't have made a better choice. We enjoyed that it was a bit off the main touristy area. Pacific Heights is a fabulous neighborhood to stroll around in, and I would recommend a walk/hike/run/bike through the nearby Presidio! So beautiful. Our room was spacious, well decorated, and clean. Sitting room, bedroom, and nice bathroom with the closet located in there. Very comfy bed, and flat screen TV with lots of channels to browse, as well as a LAN connection for free internet in the sitting room (and another TV in there, should we have wanted to watch two things separately). The breakfast was excellent. My wife in particular loved it, calling it the best one we had in SF. Good pastries, yogurt & fresh fruit, as well as some deli meats and cheeses. Two of the three nights we were able to attend the wine and cheese hour that took place from 5:30 - 7 or so, the wine wasn't stellar but hey, its free. The service and ambiance was very good, and the cheese and warm apps were tasty. Note that the street the hotel is on, Pacific Avenue, on the top of a hill, so walking north or south involves going down a fairly steep slope, making the walk back challenging :)

Reviews.Title: “More than accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Kristin011
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our trip to San Francisco. It is located in a beautiful neighborhood, the staff was more than willing to accommodate our every need and whim, the breakfast was perfect, and the beds were very comfortable. We look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a lovely neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: AlannGill
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in this hotel in Pacific Heights August 2010. The hotel was a delight, with courteous, helpful always available staff, comfortrable well equipped rooms, very good breakfast and welcome extras provided free - like the daily wine and cheese tasting late afternoon-early evening. The view over the bay is great (when the fogs lift!) and the actual neighbourhood quiet, easy to get to, well placed and very chic. Recommendations for restaurants from staff, unlike the usual tired accommodatins with local businesses, sent us to great places serving great food - like the fish restaurant in Fillmore Street. Take warm clothes though - San Francisco is COLD when the fog is in and some of the streets are dauntingly steep near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a pleasant area”
Reviews.Author: Laurasdad
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in July. Our room faced a courtyard so had no view which was disappointing as we had booked early and asked if a room with some view was possible. Not a lot of storage space in the room. Hotel location good - we used public transport and the bus is about a block away. Room OK, but not over large. Hot drinks available all day. Breakfast good, especially freshly squeezed juice. Evening cheese and wine was good. Staff very friendly and helpful without exception. For first time visitors to SF - Fisherman's Wharf is worse than they say - avoid it if possible. Bring warm clothes as it was around 60 F when we were there!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: pennsylvaniab
Reviews.Content: The Drisco is a very civilized hotel with outstanding service, located in a residential neighborhood of mansions in Pacific Heights. The hotel is quiet, the guests treated amazingly well, and the breakfast is great. my room this time was well-appointed, with a panoramic view of the city. This hotel is what we all home for in a hotel, but rarely get. My absolute favorite!

Reviews.Title: “exquisitely san franciscian, location ambience service, a back in time quality”
Reviews.Author: chrisbilljoss
Reviews.Content: enjoyed everything this hotel had to offer.a large family group enjoyed warm service and elegance.was great location to absorb this wonderful city. will saty again anytime

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place. Wouldn't want to stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaHegele
Reviews.Content: What a great place. Difficult to write about, because you want to do it justice. Iâ€™ll go through all my regular categories, but youâ€™ll see that thereâ€™s just so much more to it than solely cleanliness, food, room size and the other usual suspects. Alright, here we go: Room: Our queen bedroom was quite big, and our window faced the tiny interior courtyard. Sure, the view towards the Golden Gate Bridge would have been nicer, but we knew we had booked a budget special, so didnâ€™t expect marvelous views either. And to be honest, the nice little courtyard made it a very quiet option. The room looked just like we had imagined it from pictures on the hotelâ€™s website; a beautifully decorated room with excellent furniture and nice unique touches. We had the most comfortable, soft bathrobes, a big TV with all the channels one could possibly want, and our bathroom was fantastic both in terms of decor and size. Location: We loved staying in Pacific Heights, and we found it a really good alternative to staying in the city center. Itâ€™s a lovely neighborhood, quite affluent, with beautiful homes, and the hotel is not far away from the shops and restaurants of Fillmore Street. It doesnâ€™t take long to go the city center by bus or taxi either and we felt by staying there we got to see more than just the tourism and business centers of San Francisco. Atmosphere and service: These two go hand in hand in this hotel. The Drisco is certainly not a big anonymous chain hotel. Instead, it is friendly, more homely, welcoming and makes an effort to properly host you. We received a very warm welcome from all staff we encountered. It was always really nice to talk to the employees, from cleaner to waiter to concierge. We had a very friendly chat with the front desk when we asked for bars and clubs to go out on the weekend, and we were recommended exactly the right spots for our age group and taste in music and crowd. The cleaning lady was so mindful and always greeted us with a kind smile, and that just made for a really nice start to the day. Service is written big in this hotel. Itâ€™s not just another corporate culture value system that staff has to internalize only to forget it on their first day of work. It is omnipresent and alive and kicking! All in all, Iâ€™d say Chip Conleyâ€™s philosophy for his Joie de Vivre hotels really comes through at the Drisco - "celebrating the joy of life" surely comes naturally there. I almost forgot to mention the complimentary cheese and wine tasting in the afternoon... And yes, itâ€™s clean. Itâ€™s spick and span, everywhere. If San Francisco wasnâ€™t such a beautiful city, I would have been tempted to stay in the hotel all day. I canâ€™t wait to stay at Drisco again, should I ever be fortunate enough to revisit San Francisco. So long then!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Exclusive Neighborhood. Will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: VTJedi
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel with the help of trip advisor and the great reviews for it and I wasn't disappointed. I wasn't expecting such an old building though. I loved it for the charm, but you definitely hear people in the room above you walking around when the wood floors creek. The same with hallways - they creek loud and since the walls are thin it can easily wake you up. The beds were so comfortable though that it really didn't bother us... but I heard other guests complaining about the noise. The plumming was noisy. You could hear when anyone in a room near you turned on the shower as the walls are thin and pipes run through them. This DID NOT take away from the hotel for us. It didn't bother us and wasn't a bother... but at the price of the rooms I'm sure it would bother some. It's very very nice, offers a good breakfast with more than just pastries and coffee (fruits, cereals, breads/grains, jams, meats, cheeses, juices, etc.), and the beds and rooms are simply cozy. The amenities are great - honor bar (mini fridge where it's on your honor to tell them if you take something from it), nice HDTV with dvd player built in, free tour of your choice (not our style but nice to have it offered), comfortable beds, very nice bathrooms, bathrobes, and the list goes on. I recommend booking online through their website. it's very easy and you can actually find a better rate (deals with AAA, etc. that you can't get on a booking site). This hotel was sold out for our nights there so you should book months ahead if you can. Some ritzy snobby people stay at this hotel... I felt bad for the guy carrying this woman's luggage ordering him around where on the steps and outside she wanted each of her 7 bags for her 3 night stay. We don't fit in with that crowd, but in the dining room for breakfast felt like those were not the majority of people there. Even the staff made jokes about some of the rude guests - ha. This hotel was a splurge for us and if I'm lucky enough to get to do it again I will. The location can't be beat. It's only $10-$15 by cab to the majority of places you'll want to go... and less than that for many others. We chose to walk (yes up those hills) and didn't have much trouble. Such a nice area and so much fun! Despite what people told me here on TA, I didn't have trouble getting public transportation (Muni) from there.

Reviews.Title: “A special place to stay in Pacific Heights”
Reviews.Author: JuliaClaire
Reviews.Content: We started our trip around California from San Francisco and this was a perfect place to stay on the tail end of the trip after two busy weeks of travelling and sightseeing. It's nice to be out of the business of downtown in this amazing neighbourhood. We reserved a king bed room for under $200 a night, and it was gorgeous. The hotel is historic and charming and wonderful. Jon at the front desk tried his best to help us out but the best was the wine and cheese hour where Julio works and was incredibly sweet and helpful in finding a local amazing Italian Restaurant nearby (Via Veneto) that made our last night special and memorable. If you can't afford to buy a 14 million dollar hideaway in Pacific Heights, this is the next best thing! Don't hesitate, stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel - You'll be spoiled”
Reviews.Author: MomRocco
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days in a small suite with a king-size bed. At first I was a little concerned because the suite lacked a view as it was on the first floor, but then discovered how quiet it was and how comfy the bed was. Slept like babies. The room smelled so very fresh. The wine and cheese reception is pretty lame, so I wouldn't work my schedule around it. The breakfast is good, but by the 4th day we really hoped to find something new on the buffet. I loved the chocolate croissants that were always part of breakfast. The slippers and robe were really nice. The staff were really great. Bob and Jon were always exceptionally helpful with tips on getting around and restaurant reservations. I highly recommend Garibaldi's and Caffe Socale both of which are within walking distance of the hotel. We really loved our time at the El Drisco and were sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “A SPARKLY GEM THAT WILL KEEP YOU COMING BACK”
Reviews.Author: mizzjoy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed numerous times at this hotel. The service is always impeccable. The morning buffet breakfast is a wonderful way to start your day. It is a quiet and prestigious location of Pacific Heights. Try a large corner two room suite on the 4th floor with a king bed. This is my very favorite hotel in all of san francisco. They remember your name and there is always a warm smile and gracious service here. It is understated elegance in every way. If you want a romantic weekend, or just want to shop, this is a gem of a find! Many locals use this hotel for their wedding guests as it is such a special spot.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: LAinNY
Reviews.Content: As an earlier review noted, the Drisco feels like a hotel in Paris -- small, comfortable, quiet, and elegant without being showy. The service is impeccable, the front desk personnel knowledgeable and courteous. Rooms are lovely and well-appointed, and there're common areas off the lobby (where coffee is available at all hours) and on the ground floor, where an extensive included continental breakfast is served from 7:00 a.m.; there's wine and cheese in the afternoon. The fitness center is minimal (one each bike, treadmill, stairmaster), but guests have the use of the nearby YMCA. The hotel is situated in Pacific Heights, a quiet and upscale neighborhood (which we liked) though a walkable distance from the Fillmore District, where we found some good restaurants; we absolutely did not miss a bar/restaurant in the hotel. There's absolutely nothing not to like about the Drisco, and, as others have noted, this will be our hotel for future stays in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: mauna_kea_lady
Reviews.Content: What a great vintage hotel! Everything in perfect condition, very luxe and beautiful, very San Francisco, excellent service. Wonderful! Beautiful spacious gorgeous room (king), wonderful in-room amenities, 5 star service from bellman (Thanth is incredible!) and all front desk staff. Great complimentary breakfast. Free parking! It's fabulous being in a real residential neighborhood and away from the crowds and commercialism of Union Square. Hotel Drisco, thank you for a wonderful stay - I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect neighborhood secret”
Reviews.Author: jalwitt
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service, charming rooms, surprisingly good breakfast with oatmeal, fresh croissants and geat coffee. The suite plus bedroom was perfect for our family (3 kids plus au pair).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable with special touches”
Reviews.Author: jlbdtm
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this small, boutique hotel and not just because we got upgraded to a suite (although it was great!). This hotel was perfect for the purpose of our stay--to end our vacation in a relaxing and comfortable fashion. The staff were so eager to please and the special touches throughout the stay (fruit in our room upon arrival, cookies daily left in our room, upscale continental breakfast including lattes per request, etc...) really made this hotel stand out. We enjoyed exploring the parks, walking the hills and checking out the Fillmore Jazz Fest during our stay, but did need to take a cab downtown for most other activities (which we knew and was fine with us). A good vibe at this place, you can tell the management knows what it's visitors want and that the staff all works well together. Other than families, we were one of the younger visitors staying here (we are in our late 20's). Would highly recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and a comfortable, spacious room.”
Reviews.Author: herebedragons
Reviews.Content: We had a deluxe king on the ground floor, just around from the reception desk, and it was very spacious with a huge bathroom. Spotlessly clean, and very comfortable bed. Very accommodating when we had to reschedule due to the Icelandic volcano eruption. Excellent service all round. Staff at reception couldn't be more helpful. After busy days sightseeing we twice ordered pizza and borrowed a dvd from their vast collection ("Pacific Heights " and "Dirty Harry"!) - they have recommended take-out places as they do not have their own restaurant. Need to be reasonably fit as this part of San Francisco has very steep streets. Easy walk to Presidio and the beaches. Courtesy car will take guests to Union Square in the mornings - need to reserve. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with service to match”
Reviews.Author: poroke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Drisco for 4 nights in the beginning of June. We booked the hotel based on recommendations from other Trip Advisor reviews. It is a wonderful hotel. The staff is very gracious and very professional. They will go out of their way to make your stay most comfortable. Our spotless room was very nice with a large bathroom. Storage space was adequate. Every morning there is an elegant buffet breakfast (included with the room) served in the dining room. The buffet tables were always attended to so that they were well stocked and clean and neat. Espresso and capuccino were available. Classical music plays in the background to help set the classy ambience. Newspapers (various local and national) were available. Also, the local paper was delivered to our room daily. In the evening, from 5:30-6:30, complimentary wine and cheese were served by the tuxedoed butler. A great way to start your evening before exploring SF and its amazing restaurants. The hotel is located in an exclusive area called Pacific Heights. It is a very quiet area with numerous elegant homes. It sits atop the hill with terrific views. Street parking is readily available as we had a car and had no problems parking. We took the car with us every day but if you leave a car there during the day note that there are time limits. 2-3 hour parking zones require that the car be moved. The front desk will move your car for you if you leave it. Just sign a waiver allowing them to do this. This is a great perk to have as an option. Public buses are very reliable and close by. Hotel Drisco is a gem of a hotel. We look forward to future visits to SF and most definitely our stay at Hotel Drisco.

Reviews.Title: “elegant retreat after major sightseeing and theater events”
Reviews.Author: karen3459
Reviews.Content: Staff was very courteous. The front desk services all-encompassing and friendly. Helpful with cab service during rush hour. Concierge brochures outstanding and most helpful. Breakfast and cocktail hour very nice, casual. Loved the selection, wine, and h'ors d'oeuvres. Loved the view from the corner suite window: tip of Coit Tower and Pyramid Building. Loved walking almost everywhere. Saw the Parrots of Telegraph in Pacific Heights, quiet residential neighborhood; what fun!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Drisco is a wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: LNG7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I lived in San Francisco many years ago and travel back every few years. We usually stay in the downtown area but decided to give Hotel Drisco in Pacific Heights a try this time. (My first trip to San Francisco was a very long time ago, I was quite young, and stayed at the then-called El Drisco Hotel; the years have been kind to this hotel and it is much better now than it was back "in the day.") Our room was lovely, quite upscale and very comfortable. The bathroom was huge. The bathrobes, slippers and bath products were all great. The closet (with safe) was large. Best of all was the service. From check-in to check-out , everyone who works there was helpful, kind and not pretentious (a plus in our book). The breakfast and wine hour were both great in lovely surroundings. Another huge plus was the way the staff moved our rental car when necessary so that we wouldn't be ticketed! Since the hotel is not air conditioned, it would have been problemmatic if the city had been hot (an unusual but not unheard of occurence). As it were, it was usual San Francisco weather while we were there...quite cool and rainy. (The hotel let us borrow an umbrella, which was helpfun.) The location is wonderful but residential. The neighborhood is very upscale, beautiful homes, gorgeous views but not within easy walking distance to restaurants, shops, movies, etc. A car or cab is necessary for going to these activities. Would we stay here again? Most definitely, and we highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Everything everyone says it is”
Reviews.Author: alipeach
Reviews.Content: We just came back from three nights at The Drisco and it was everything everyone said it was. Service was great from check in to check out and there were many wonderful small touches. Coffee to go as we began our daily treks all over the City and scented ice water on our return. The neighborhood was great, but it is off the beaten path. For us this was a plus, we had been to San Francisco several times and wanted to stay in a different area. We were so happy we did otherwise we may not have experienced the incredible homes and breathtaking views. The breakfast was great, lots of choices, fresh and really convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want and more”
Reviews.Author: WatergirlEvanston
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about our recent stay at the Drisco. There is much to enjoy at this hotel--- but it really stands out for its staff, service, location (incredible views).

Reviews.Title: “When in SF, Drisco's the place”
Reviews.Author: sadeja
Reviews.Content: One doesn't know where to start telling all the good things about this hotel. It's seriously a no-brainer for SF - location is hard to beat and the hotel is worth every penny you pay for your stay. If I knew where to buy the mattress we had in our room, I'd do it right now, no joke. I am a picky hotel guest, and Drisco exceeded my expectations and then some!

Reviews.Title: “First stay in San Francisco, would not look anywere else”
Reviews.Author: JD_at_TripA
Reviews.Content: Loved the Drisco. Classy hotel with great service in a beautiful neighborhood. From the moment we walked in the door the staff took care of our needs from help with parking to arranging for more of the delicious cookies that were brought upon our arrival. Edward was especially helpful with information on an event we were in town for and in giving us an excellent recommendation on a restaurant that was within walking distance. The room was well appointed (see photos) and the bed and linens were the best. The continental breakfast was a notch above, just like the hotel itself. Our one day in San Francisco was definitely made more memorable by our stay at the Drisco.

Reviews.Title: “on bad days i close my eyes and think of hotel drisco!”
Reviews.Author: totallyali
Reviews.Content: This was one of my all time favourite hotels - the atmosphere was just lovely - the room was gorgeous - it felt personal and welcoming - a million miles from big corporation hotels. It does not have a "grand" entrance but the experience was certainly five star for me. the setting is great - the breakfasts were fantastic - we had the most relaxing time there. Now that it is a recession i sometimes close my eyes and remember it ...

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: NVRam123
